Key:
I-If I have to pick one person... I guess I'd
choose Tohka.

I don't get it, Shido. Why aren't you saying that
you want to come with me?

Questionable. Why did you choose Tohka?
I request an explanation.

W-Well, uh... Because I made plans with her a
long time ago. I told her that we'd go to eat
some kinako bread. Right, Tohka?

Oh! Come to think of it... You're right, Shido!
You did promise me that you'd let me try
kinako bread!

What?! No fair, Tohka-sannn. Darling, last time
we had to cut our afternoon tea short.

Even if you promised, it doesn't have to be
now. It can be 10 years from now, or 20 years
from now. Shido, you should choose me.
Ngh... It's no use. This is getting out of hand.

(I know! At a time like this... I'm going to have
to call the Fraxinus for help...)

(Whenever I run into issues, they always give me
some pointers or instructions. They should be
able to save me from this situation...!)
Oh, you seem to be in trouble, Shido.
Perfect timing, Kotori.

(My little sister Kotori is the Commander of the
Fraxinus. She should be a dependable advisor at
a time like this... I think.)
Can you solve this problem for me?
Hmm. The girls in front of you, aside from\nOrigami, may possibly go berserk if you\nhurt them carelessly. You know that, right?
I know that. That's why I'm struggling.
And you're going to choose Tohka, knowing\nthat?

Well, it seems like I have to choose someone
now... So I thought I'd choose Tohka, since I
made plans with her before.
I see. Well, surprisingly, it looks like you've\nthought it through for once. Then you do that.\nI'll handle the others.
Got it. Thanks.
All right, Tohka.
Hm?
Let's run for it.
What?!
(And so, Tohka and I ran off toward town.)
Ah, this kinako bread is quite delicious.
Really? That's great. Then eat it all, okay?
What?! I can eat all of this?

Of course you can. But it'll be dinnertime when we
get back, so don't overeat, okay?
B-But I thought you wanted some too, Shido.

Huh? Well, it wasn't exactly that. I ran
because... I guess I didn't have time?
Oh... Really? Th-Then... Why?
Hm?

Um... You chose me, didn't you?
You didn't have to fulfill your promise today...
Well, I guess so. But I just decided to do it.
Just because you promised me?

I told you that wasn't the case, right? I chose
you because... Well, because it was you, Tohka.
What does that mean? I don't get it...

W-Well... I haven't been able to talk to you
much lately. And besides, it's thanks to you
that I can be here like this.
Huh?

Up until this spring, I had a life that had
nothing to do with Spirits or girls. At least,
as far as I remember.

But things have changed. I was able to meet a
Spirit for the first time and talk to her. That
was you, Tohka.

Right! Back then, there was no Yoshino,
Kaguya, Yuzuru, or Miku, right?

Exactly. When I met you back then, you were so
different. You never listened to what we had to
say...
W-Well, the Mekameka guys...

Yeah, I know... The AST attacked, right?
That's why you thought everyone in this world
was your enemy.

But you changed that view, Shido. You told me
I was no different from a human.
Tohka...
And you taught me about kinako bread, too!
That's right, I did. It's delicious, isn't it?
Yes! It's the best!

Shido, you chose me because I'm the first Spirit
you ever met, right?

Well, that's not the only reason. I just thought
if I had to choose one person, it'd have to be
you.
...?! I-It'd... have to be me...?!

What's the matter, Tohka?!
Did you choke on the bread?

N-N-N-No, it's nothing. Y-Yeah... This kinako
bread is so delicious!
Haha, you're funny...
I-I'm not funny, Shido! It's the kinako bread.
That's not what I meant...
Hm?
Nothing.
Thank you, Shido. I appreciate it.

Yeah, I've been meaning to have you try this
bread.

Th-That's not what I meant... U-Um... the fact
that you chose... Ahh...
Hm? What is it?

Nothing! All right, let's go back and have
supper!
Oh, you're right. Let's go home.
Okay!
